uk.co.edgeorgedev.notifj.notification

Interface Notification

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GrowlNotification, OSXGrowlNotification, WindowsGrowlNotification

    public interface Notification
    An object that implements the Notification interface generates visible messages to a user with a specified title and message body.

    For example, the following will create a Growl Notification that will display until it is dismissed by a user: 

     GrowlNotification notif = new GrowlNotification("Test Application").sticky();
 notif.open();
 notif.show("Hello", "World");

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ed George

    • Method Detail

      • open

        void open()
          throws NotificationException
        Completes any setup required to generate messages.
        Throws:
        NotificationException - if the setup required for creating notifications fails.
        Since:
        1.0

      • show

        void show(java.lang.String title,
        java.lang.String message)
          throws NotificationException
        Displays a notification to the user.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the notification.
        message - the message body of the notification.
        Throws:
        NotificationException - if the creation or displaying of any notification(s) fails.
        Since:
        1.0

      • close

        void close()
           throws NotificationException
        Completes any cleanup required once a Notification is no longer to be used.
        Throws:
        NotificationException - if the cleanup fails.
        Since:
        1.0

      • sticky

        Notification sticky()
        Enables any subsequent notifications to be sticky by being displayed until dismissed
        Returns:
        the modified Notification object
        Since:
        1.2

      • sticky

        Notification sticky(boolean sticky)
        Enables/Disables any subsequent notifications to be sticky by being displayed until dismissed
        Parameters:
        sticky - true if sticky Growl Notifications are to be enabled and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        the modified Notification object
        Since:
        1.2
        See Also:
        sticky()

      • isSticky

        boolean isSticky()
        Check if notifications are sticky
        Returns:
        true if notifications generated by this object are sticky and false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.2

      • callbackUrl

        Notification callbackUrl(java.net.URL callback_url)
        Adds a callback url to notifications.

        When certain notification are clicked, this URL will be opened by the system's default browser

        Parameters:
        callback_url - the callback URL to open - null can be used to remove the callback as can removeCallback()
        Returns:
        the modified Notification object
        Since:
        1.2
        See Also:
        removeCallback()

      • removeCallback

        Notification removeCallback()
        Removes any previously associated callback.
        Returns:
        the modified Notification object
        Since:
        1.2
        See Also:
        callbackUrl(URL)

      • getCallbackUrl

        java.net.URL getCallbackUrl()
        Get the notification's callback URL
        Returns:
        the callback URL - null if the callback is not set
        Since:
        1.2
